clinical_study.brief_title: Multidrug Resistant Gram-negative Bacilli Colonization and Infection in Burn
clinical_study.official_title: IGHID 11519 - Multidrug Resistant Gram-negative Bacilli Colonization and Infection in Burn

lead_sponsor.agency: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

collaborator.agency: North Carolina Translational and Clinical Sciences Institute

clinical_study.source: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective observational study to determine the role of colonization and identify the timing of development of drug resistance in multidrug resistant Gram-negative bacilli (MDR-GNB) causing infection among critically ill burn patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a prospective observational study. Patients will be followed during a single admission for development of colonization or infection with MDR-GNB. Patient clinical characteristics, including infections, surgeries, and antibiotic exposure, will be collected in real-time.
Weekly surveillance wound and peri-rectal swabs and, if intubated, biweekly deep endotracheal or tracheostomy aspirates will be collected, de-identified, and stored from all patients and examined for the presence of MDR-GNB. All GNB isolates from blood, urine, respiratory, and wound cultures will be collected, coded, and stored.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From hospital admission through length of hospital stay, or date of death from any cause, whichever comes first (assessed up to 52 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Endotracheal tube or tracheostomy aspirates will be obtained upon admission and twice weekly; wound and perirectal area swabs will be collected weekly and will be used to characterize species.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From hospital admission until discharge from unit, or date of death from any cause (assessed up to 1 year)
primary_outcome.description: surveillance samples for bacterial colonization will be collected weekly

primary_outcome.measure: Time to development of MDR and extreme drug resistant bacteria
primary_outcome.time_frame: From hospital admission until date of development of MDR or extremely drug resistant bacteria (assessed up to 52 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: surveillance samples will be collected weekly

primary_outcome.time_frame: Time of hospital admission until date of development of VAT/VAP or date of death from any cause (assessed up to 52 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: defined by bacteria obtained from clinical bronchoscopy and patient symptoms as noted by chart review

primary_outcome.time_frame: From hospital admission until date of development of MDR-GNB VAT/VAP or date of death from any cause (assessed up to 52 weeks)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Burn patients with VAT or VAP with MDR-GNB
arm_group.description: Adult patients with burn and/or inhalation injury requiring intubation

intervention.arm_group_label: Burn patients with VAT or VAP with MDR-GNB

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients (18 years of age or older) hospitalized in the NC Jaycee Burn Center who require intubation at or less than 24 hours prior to admission as well as those with 20% or more total body surface area burn, with the anticipation that these patients will subsequently require intubation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Severe burn injury, including partial or full thickness burn 20% or more total body surface area; or
2. inhalation injury; or
3. 18 years of age or older;
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Intensive care unit stay of less than 5 days;
2. ICU admission more than 48 hours after burn trauma.
